comment._content: Lined up for chow.  Some things don't change much!

comment.author: 8716770@N08
comment._content: Probably 1912 given the Bain number system in reverse on right hand side.

comment.author: 53461717@N08
comment._content:
Made a copy, enlarged the poststamp on the right upper corner, darkened and constrasted it and found
2/24/11 in mirror view (Fegruary 24, 1911?)
Dr. Roberto Duarte
Plastic Surgeon

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content:
Dr. Duarte:

Thanks for the detective work on the date of this photograph. Those stickers are the hardest ones to read!  We will add the date to the record.

comment.author: 53461717@N08
comment._content: The Washington Times on March 7th, 1911 (Chronicling America) chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn84026749/1911-03-07/ed-... infomed that American army was rushed to Mexican Border On February 24, 1911, were the soldiers in Galveston, waiting orders to rush to the Mexican Border?
